start.speaker: Keystone
start.text:
Three seals are not a key.
They are proof you can survive the price.

The Keystone Trial does not test strength. It tests what you keep when strength is gone.

choices.text: Enter anyway. The hesitation is part of it.

vow.speaker: Keystone
vow.text:
You do not win.
You are measured.

And the measure approves enough of you to let you pass.

end.speaker: Narrator
end.text:
The contract closes with a sound like a book shutting in an empty room.

You can walk away, but you cannot walk back into who you were.
